thread.title: Dormont Homeowner Finds Man Shot To Death In Backyard
thread.title_full: Dormont Homeowner Finds Man Shot To Death In Backyard

author: CBS Pittsburgh
title: Dormont Homeowner Finds Man Shot To Death In Backyard
text:
Dormont Homeowner Finds Man Shot To Death In Backyard January 5, 2017 3:05 PM By Lynne Hayes-Freeland Filed Under: Allegheny County , Death Investigation , Dormont , Espy Avenue , Lynne Hayes-Freeland 
DORMONT (KDKA) — Police are investigating after a shooting victim’s body was found Thursday in a backyard in Dormont. 
Investigators were called to the 2700-block of Espy Avenue over reports of an unresponsive man found in a yard. 
Just before noon, a neighbor, who does not want to be identified, says as she let her dog out, she noticed a man in her backyard with his head on her bottom step. He wasn’t moving. A Dormont homeowner finds a man shot to death in the back yard. pic.twitter.com/zZqF963fS7 
— Lynne Hayes-Freeland (@PghLynne) January 5, 2017 
Police say the yard is shielded from the view of the street. 
“This was a nice neighborhood, till this got to it,” said neighbor Richard Maier. “It’s scary.” 
The 35-year-old man had been shot at least twice and was pronounced dead at the scene. His name has not yet been released. 
According to police, he may have been involved in a shooting incident the night before, ran from the scene and hid in the yard. 
That incident happened around 8 p.m. Wednesday at the intersection of LaSalle and Broadway Avenues. 
“About 8 o’clock last night, I heard fireworks. I looked out the window and didn’t see nothing,” said Maier. “I just heard fireworks… like rapid fire.” 
Anyone with information on the case is asked to call Dormont Police or the Allegheny County Police homicide unit at 412-473-1300 . 
They are also asking anyone with surveillance cameras in the area to contact them.
